pingball.physics

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A board represents the playing area for a game of Pingball. Boards are defined to have sizes of 20 x 20 for the playing area with an outer wall surrounding this 20 x 20 area. By default, a board has gravity set to 25 L/sec^2 and two friction constants set to .025 1/sec and .025 1/L. However, the gravity of the board may be changed. By definition, due to the standards of the graphics community, the upper left corner of a board is location (0, 0) while the bottom right corner of the board is location (20, 20).
    **************************THREAD SAFETY ARGUMENT***************************
    All gadgets and balls that are used in a board are internally contained. To add a gadget or ball to a board, the parameters that would be needed for construction are passed in and then an internal variant of said objects are created for usage. This ensures that references to any internal data types are completely contained within an instance of board. Moreover, all publicly accessible methods that are sensitive to mutations are synchronized about the instance of the board. This ensures that all mutator methods obtain a lock on the instance and perform all of their operations atomically before allowing anything else to happen to the board. This allows multiple threads to handle a board instance whether the threads are issuing observing, mutating or both types of commands. The main argument is containment and synchronization. The only data type that this doesn't apply to is the linked blocking queue that is used to tell the server that a ball needs to get sent to another board. In this case, the queue blocks safely, so that the listening end will not do anything until the board sends the ball out. Furthermore, once the ball gets sent out, it is deleted from the board entirely, and hence doesn't pose a potential leak in memory. If you look at the client code which contains this board, you'll notice that the ball itself isn't sent out and only a text version that contains only necessary data for ball construction is sent across threads, this allows the ball to be ultimately contained within the thread anyways.
    Author:
    enguyen, nconsul, spefley

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(java.lang.String name,
     double gravity,
     double mu,
     double mu2,
     java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<Pair<Ball,Pair<java.lang.String,Side>>> out)
        Internal constructor that builds the board object based on desired parameters. The board is empty and will contain the desired gravity and friction constants.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this board, valid iff named is true
        gravity - the desired gravitational acceleration in the board
        mu - the desired friction constant in units of 1/sec
        mu2 - the desired friction constant in units of 1/L
        out - a queue to the server that will be used to send balls that need to move to another board over.

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Returns the name of this board. If unnamed, an empty string is returned
        Returns:
        the name of the board

      • addSquareBumper

        public void addSquareBumper(java.lang.String name,
                   int x,
                   int y)
        Creates and ads a square shaped bumper to the board with the given parameters and with a reflection coefficient of 1.0.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bumper, must be unique among all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= x < 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= y < 20 in units of L

                       int x,
                       int y,
                       Orientation orientation)

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the bumper, must be unique among all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= x < 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this bumper, 0 <= y < 20 in units of L
        orientation - the orientation clockwise in degrees from the horizontal that this bumper is initialized in.

      • addAbsorber

        public void addAbsorber(java.lang.String name,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Creates and adds a new absorber to the board based with the given parameters and with coefficient of reflection equal to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the absorber, must be unique among all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this absorber, 0 <= x + width <= 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this absorber, 0 <= y + width <= 20 in units of L
        width - the desired width of this absorber, 1 <= width in units of L
        height - the desired height of this absorber, 1 <= height in units of L

      • addLeftFlipper

        public void addLeftFlipper(java.lang.String name,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  Orientation orientation)
        Creates and adds a new left flipper to the board based with the given parameters and with coefficient of reflection equal to 1.0. The '2' in the requirements below takes into account the size 2L x 2L bounding box for flippers
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the flipper, must be unique among all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this flipper, 0 <= x + 2 <= 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this flipper, 0 <= y + 2 <= 20 in units of L
        orientation - the orientation clockwise in degrees from the horizontal that this flipper is initialized in.

                   int x,
                   int y,
                   Orientation orientation)

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the flipper, must be unique among all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this flipper, 0 <= x + 2 <= 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this flipper, 0 <= y + 2 <= 20 in units of L
        orientation - the orientation clockwise in degrees from the horizontal that this flipper is initialized in.

      • addBall

        public void addBall(java.lang.String name,
           double x,
           double y,
           double vX,
           double vY)
        Adds a ball to this board with the specified parameters and with a default diameter of 0.5 L. The .25 below refers to the radius of the ball
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the ball, must be unique across all named objects in the board
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this ball, 0 <= x + .25 <= 20 in units of L
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this ball, 0 <= y + .25 <= 20 in units of L
        vX - the horizontal velocity of the ball in units of L/sec
        vY - the vertical velocity of the ball in units of L/sec

      • addBall

        public void addBall(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Adds a ball to this board with the specified tokens. Tokens must be in the form ["BALL", vx, vy, x, y, name]
        Parameters:
        tokens - the strings that describe the ball in the above format

      • connectBoard

        public java.lang.String connectBoard(java.lang.String boardName,
                            Side side)
        Connects a board to this board on the designated side.
        Parameters:
        boardName - the name of th board to be connected to this
        side - the side on which the board should be connected
        Returns:
        the name of the board previously connected on the specified side, empty if no board was there

      • disconnectBoard

        public java.lang.String disconnectBoard(java.lang.String boardName)
        Removes the board connected to the specified side
        Parameters:
        boardName - the name of the board that needs to be disconnected from this board
        side - the side that the designated board is supposedly on to be disconnected
        Returns:
        the name of the disconnected board, or an empty string if no board was disconnected
